Document.Title: T-SQL: User-Defined Function Structure; Table/Set Form

Content:
USE [Database]
GO

IF OBJECT_ID('fUserDefined') IS NOT NULL 
BEGIN 
    DROP FUNCTION fUserDefined
    IF OBJECT_ID('fUserDefined') IS NOT NULL
        PRINT '<<< FAILED DROPPING FUNCTION fUserDefined >>>'
    ELSE 
        PRINT '<<< DROPPED FUNCTION fUserDefined >>>'
END
GO

CREATE FUNCTION dbo.fUserDefined
    (
        @param1 varchar(255) = NULL
    )
RETURNS @set TABLE (idx smallint PRIMARY KEY, value varchar(1024))
AS
BEGIN

/*
    Description: 
    Developer: Bryan Wilhite

    INSERT INTO @set (idx, value) VALUES (@idx, @value)
*/

RETURN
END
GO

GRANT SELECT ON fUserDefined TO public
GO

IF OBJECT_ID('fUserDefined') IS NOT NULL 
    PRINT '<<< CREATED FUNCTION fUserDefined >>>' 
ELSE 
    PRINT '<<< FAILED CREATING FUNCTION fUserDefined >>>' 
GO
